# HTML Form

By using [jsonschema.org](http://jsonschema.net/#/), we created a stub for a JSON schema. This schema was tweaked and changed to make it match the media type definition.

You can find the schema here: [conference-talk-schema.md](conference-talk-schema.md).

Subsequently, we used [http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor](http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor) to generate a form to fill in such JSON structures.

## Running the editor

For now, use this little link here: [JSON Editor](http://jeremydorn.com/json-editor/?&value=N4IgDgTg9mUM4EMA2IBcoAuBLDSCmaIIANCAEYRZ4BmAtACZ5wDGlY2UAdoSSNQK5IkDJqyzssXHqQDWeAJ4B3KBHpw0AbQC6pfJwDmGABZpQkGnggQ89NAAZSAWyzdUDkI4QAPewF9S5nB4nBiW6qjaui4y4ZHgCHAYtIHBGAgcnLFa/uDWQSFhmtlAAA==&theme=bootstrap3&iconlib=&object_layout=grid&show_errors=interaction&ajax&disable_edit_json&disable_properties&disable_array_reorder)
